turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Judkins shogi.
turn.1: How do you promote in Judkins?
turn.2: Promotion is effected by turning the piece over after it moves, revealing the name of its promoted rank.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Promoting a piece has the effect of changing how that piece moves until it is removed from the board.
turn.6: Each piece promotes as follows: If a pawn or knight reaches the furthest rank, it must be promoted, since it would otherwise have no legal move on subsequent turns.
turn.7: Can you tell me more about the knight?
turn.8: For the same reason, a knight reaching the penultimate rank must be promoted.
turn.9: Is there anything else that is interesting about promotion?
turn.10: When captured, pieces lose their promoted status.
turn.11: Why do they lose their promoted status?
